contextId.occurrenceNote: The servant is comparing how much more willing Naaman should be to obey a simple command since he is willing to obey a difficult one. Alternate translation: "How much more willing you should be to obey" or "Should you not be even more willing to obey" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
The understood information may be supplied. Alternate translation: "If you will not take the gifts I have brought for you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])

The words "was sold for" are understood from the previous phrase. They can be repeated here. Alternate translation: "dove's dung was sold for" or "dove's dung cost" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
It is understood that he sent a person. Alternate translation: "has sent someone to" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
The understood verb may be supplied. Alternate translation: "avenge the blood" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
